text.sentence: Healthcare | U.S. Health Care Distribution and Technology five August two thousand fifteen Stock Rating
ninebn was unfortunately clouded by weak revenue of dollar one.one

The revenue miss was attributable to several factors, including: one) lower third party services compared to twoQthirteen; two) management's overly aggressive forecasting of servicesrelated resources and associated revenue; and three) a larger mix of long term contracts resulting in lower in quarter revenue.
Despite the top line miss, Cerner reported EPS of dollar .fifty
Similar to oneQ, the revenue shortfall was attributable to low margin contributors.

Revenue totaled dollar one thousand one hundred twenty sixmn, of which Cerner contributed dollar eight hundred sixty sixmn and Health Services contributed dollar two hundred sixtymn Â­ dollar fiftymn below our estimate.
Unlike the prior quarter, eighty percent of the shortfall was attributable to `core' Cerner.
However, this was primarily related to low margin third party services and zero margin reimbursed travel, and had little impact on profits.
Bookings strength continued in twoQfifteen, increasing twenty percent y/y to dollar one.twenty
Bookings from outside the client base accounted for thirty four percent of total in twoQfifteen, in line with the long term average of thirty percent thirty five percent .
Long term bookings were again elevated at thirty five percent of total, as compared to a record thirty seven percent last quarter.
For a second quarter in a row, earnings met expectations and the range was narrowed to the positive.
The revenue shortfall in low margin Services business and zero margin Reimbursed Travel was offset by continued expense control, leading to EPS of dollar .fifty
The company narrowed the full year EPS range to dollar two.nine dollar two.fifteen, up from the prior range of dollar two.seven to dollar two.fifteen.
We maintain our Overweight rating and target price of dollar eighty five.

U.S. Health Care Distribution and Technology Industry View: POSITIVE Stock Rating: OVERWEIGHT two thousand fourteenA three thousand four hundred three one thousand one hundred thirty two eight hundred twenty nine seven hundred seventy seven five hundred eighty one.sixty
two thousand fifteenE four thousand five hundred twenty three one thousand two hundred seventy four eight hundred thirty four seven hundred fifty six seven hundred fifty two two.thirteen

CAGR N/A N/A N/A N/A N/A N/A N/A N/A N/A N/A N/A N/A N/A Average thirty four.six
After several years of share gains, Cerner has a strong installed base and opportunities to increase revenue via greater capture of customers' total HCIT spending.
Management has shown the ability to continuously innovate and we expect Cerner's customers will look to the company to help them navigate the transition to increasingly valuebased reimbursement.
Cerner's newer solutions gain traction within its customer base faster than expected.
We see upside in the multiple to eighteenx two thousand sixteen adjusted EV/EBITDA, implying a stock valuation of dollar ninety.
Failure to meet high bookings and revenue growth expectations as clients reduce spending post stimulus.
We see downside in the multiple to thirteenx two thousand sixteen adjusted EV/EBITDA, implying a stock valuation of dollar sixty five.

ninebn, up twenty percent y/y and above our estimate of dollar one.twenty
fourbn, was unfortunately clouded by weak revenue of dollar one.one

The revenue miss was attributable to several factors, including: one) lower third party services compared to twoQthirteen; two) management's overly aggressive forecasting of services related resources and associated revenue; and three) a larger mix of long term contracts resulting in lower in quarter revenue.
Despite the top line miss, Cerner reported EPS of dollar .fifty

two, in line with our estimate, as the decline in low margin third party services and zero margin reimbursed travel impacted revenue but had little impact on profitability and the company continued to tightly manage expenses.
Bookings strength continued in twoQfifteen, increasing twenty percent y/y to dollar one.twenty
ninebn, at the high end of the company's guidance for dollar one.twenty
Bookings from outside the client base accounted for thirty four percent of the total in twoQfifteen in line with the long term average of thirty percent thirty five percent .
Long term bookings represented thirty five percent of total, or dollar four hundred fifty twomn, slightly down from a record thirty seven percent last quarter.
Separately, bookings also included twenty three large contracts, an all time high and up twenty one percent from twoQfourteen.
We expect the number of large contracts will continue to grow as all new wins include revenue cycle and Cerner gains further momentum in its outsourced Works offering.
Baptist Health South Florida operates six hospitals ranging from small to large .
We believe the system currently uses Soarian Financials and a legacy Siemens clinical system.
Cerner will implement its Millennium EHR and HealtheIntent population health solutions across BHSF's entire acute and ambulatory network.
We view the win positively and believe it demonstrates Cerner's ability to retain and migrate a relatively large customer that conducted a competitive vendor selection process.
Cerner signed an ITWorks agreement with Catholic Health Initiatives in July and will manage IT operations for forty seven of the health system's hospitals.
Cerner reduced full year revenue guidance while increasing the bottom of the EPS range.

Guidance for two thousand fifteen revenue was reduced to dollar four.four hundred seventy fivebn to dollar four.five hundred seventy fivebn, down from the prior range of dollar four.sixty five dollar four.eightbn.
Earnings guidance was expanded to dollar two.nine dollar two.fifteen from the prior range of dollar two.seven to dollar two.fifteen.
We were encouraged by management's expectations for flat y/y operating margins, compared to prior estimates of a two hundredbp decline .

The positive outlook for twoH is driven by: one) growth in high margin software sales; two) revenue decline in low margin services that will have little impact on profitability; and three) continued expense controls across the core and Health Services businesses.
Cerner ended the quarter with dollar eight hundred fifty sevenmn of total cash and investments.
The company generated dollar one hundred ninemn of operating cash flow, down to the expected Siemens voluntary separation plan expense and lower
Barclays | Cerner Corp. collections relayed to delayed Health Services billings.
Capital expenditures totalled dollar eighty fivemn and capitalized software was dollar seventymn, resulting in FCF of negative dollar forty sixmn.

The company expects FCF to increase in the coming quarters as acquisition related expenses decline and DSO improves, even after considering HS expenditures and CapEx related to the construction of Cerner's new campus.
We reiterate our Overweight rating and dollar eighty five price target.
Our two thousand fifteen EPS estimate increases to dollar two.thirteen, up from dollar two.twelve, to reflect a stronger margin run rate in twoH.

Our DCFbased dollar eighty five price target equates to a target EV/EBITDA multiple of eighteenx our two thousand sixteen adjusted EBITDA estimate and a P/E target of thirty fourx our two thousand sixteen EPS estimate of dollar two.fifty one.

The Investment Bank's Research Department produces various types of research including, but not limited to, fundamental analysis, equity linked analysis, quantitative analysis, and trade ideas.

Recommendations contained in one type of research product may differ from recommendations contained in other types of research, whether as a result of differing time horizons, methodologies, or otherwise.

Primary Stocks Cerner Corp., Overweight/Positive, C/J Disclosure Legend: A: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate has been lead manager or co lead manager of a publicly disclosed offer of securities of the issuer in the previous twelve months.

At any given time, its associated Designated Market Maker may have long or short inventory position in the stock; and its associated Designated Market Maker may be on the opposite side of orders executed on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange in the stock.

P: A partner, director or officer of Barclays Capital Canada Inc. has, during the preceding twelve months, provided services to the subject company for remuneration, other than normal course investment advisory or trade execution services.

U: The equity securities of this Canadian issuer include subordinate voting restricted shares.
V: The equity securities of this Canadian issuer include non voting restricted shares.
Risk Disclosure Master limited partnerships are pass through entities structured as publicly listed partnerships.
For tax purposes, distributions to MLP unit holders may be treated as a return of principal.
Investors should consult their own tax advisors before investing in MLP units.

Guide to the Barclays Fundamental Equity Research Rating System: Our coverage analysts use a relative rating system in which they rate stocks as Overweight, Equal Weight or Underweight relative to other companies covered by the analyst or a team of analysts that are deemed to be in the same industry .
In addition to the stock rating, we provide industry views which rate the outlook for the industry coverage universe as Positive, Neutral or Negative .
A rating system using terms such as buy, hold and sell is not the equivalent of our rating system.
Investors should carefully read the entire research report including the definitions of all ratings and not infer its contents from ratings alone.
Stock Rating Overweight The stock is expected to outperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.
Equal Weight The stock is expected to perform in line with the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelvemonth investment horizon.
Underweight The stock is expected to underperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.

Rating Suspended The rating and target price have been suspended temporarily due to market events that made coverage impracticable or to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies in certain circumstances including where the Investment Bank of Barclays Bank PLC is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving the company.
Neutral industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are steady, neither improving nor deteriorating.

Below is the list of companies that constitute the industry coverage universe: U.S. Health Care Distribution and Technology Allscripts Healthcare Solutions, Inc. Cardinal Health Inc. McKesson Corp. PharMerica Corporation VWR Corp. Distribution of Ratings: Barclays Equity Research has two thousand seven hundred two companies under coverage.

forty three percent have been assigned an Overweight rating which, for purposes of mandatory regulatory disclosures, is classified as a Buy rating; fifty two percent of companies with this rating are investment banking clients of the Firm.

forty one percent have been assigned an Equal Weight rating which, for purposes of mandatory regulatory disclosures, is classified as a Hold rating; forty five percent of companies with this rating are investment banking clients of the Firm.

fourteen percent have been assigned an Underweight rating which, for purposes of mandatory regulatory disclosures, is classified as a Sell rating; forty percent of companies with this rating are investment banking clients of the Firm.
Guide to the Barclays Research Price Target: Each analyst has a single price target on the stocks that they cover.
The price target represents that analyst's expectation of where the stock will trade in the next twelve months.
Upside/downside scenarios, where provided, represent potential upside/potential downside to each analyst's price target over the same twelve month period.
Top Picks: Barclays Equity Research's Top Picks represent the single best alpha generating investment idea within each industry, taken from among the Overweight rated stocks within that industry.
Barclays Equity Research publishes global and regional Top Picks reports every quarter and analysts may also publish intra quarter changes to their Top Picks, as necessary.
While analysts may highlight other Overweight rated stocks in their published research in addition to their Top Pick, there can only be one Top Pick for each industry.
To view the current list of Top Picks, go to the Top Picks page on Barclays Live .
To see a list of companies that comprise a particular industry coverage universe, please go to http://publicresearch.barclays

Source: Thomson Reuters, Barclays Research Historical stock prices and price targets may have been adjusted for stock splits and dividends.
C: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate is a market maker and/or liquidity provider in equity securities issued by Cerner Corp. or one of its affiliates.

J: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate trades regularly in the securities of Cerner Corp.. Valuation Methodology: Our dollar eighty five price target is derived from DCF analysis based on a discount rate of seven percent and a terminal growth rate of three percent .
This target price equates to a target EV/EBITDA multiple of eighteenx our two thousand sixteen adjusted EBITDA estimate and a P/E target of thirty fourx our two thousand sixteen EPS estimate.
Risks which May Impede the Achievement of the Barclays Research Price Target: one) High bookings growth expectations represent a near term risk for Cerner each quarter.
two) Failure to execute on the double digit top line growth presents a long term risk to our growth outlook.
three) The company faces increasing competition from new healthcare entrants and established non healthcare entrants.four)
Mismanagement of the Siemens installed base causes lower than expected customer retention and is a significant burden on costs and management attention
